mold noun
(SHAPE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a hollow container into which you pour a soft or liquid substance so that it will cool or harden into the shape of the container: The pieces are made in a mold and I just paint them.
mold noun
(GROWTH)
[ U ] a soft green, gray, or black growth that develops on old food or on objects that have been left too long in warm, slightly wet places Idiom
in the mold of someone/something
mold verb [T]
(SHAPE)
to shape something into a particular form: She molded the clay into little animals.
Someone who molds someone else has an important influence on how that person develops: Parents help mold a child’s character.
